Package ch.bailu.gtk.gio

Interface TlsError

public interface TlsError

https://docs.gtk.org/

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    BAD_CERTIFICATE
    The certificate presented could not
    be parsed or failed validation.
    static final int
    BAD_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD
    The certificate failed
    to load because a password was incorrect.
    static final int
    CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED
    The TLS handshake failed because
    the server requested a client-side certificate, but none was
    provided.
    static final int
    EOF
    The TLS connection was closed without proper
    notice, which may indicate an attack.
    static final int
    HANDSHAKE
    The TLS handshake failed because the
    peer's certificate was not acceptable.
    static final int
    INAPPROPRIATE_FALLBACK
    The TLS handshake failed
    because the client sent the fallback SCSV, indicating a protocol
    downgrade attack.
    static final int
    MISC
    Miscellaneous TLS error
    static final int
    NOT_TLS
    The TLS handshake failed because the
    peer does not seem to be a TLS server.
    static final int
    UNAVAILABLE
    No TLS provider is available

    • CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED

      static final int CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED
      The TLS handshake failed because
      the server requested a client-side certificate, but none was
      provided. See g_tls_connection_set_certificate().
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • EOF

      static final int EOF
      The TLS connection was closed without proper
      notice, which may indicate an attack. See
      g_tls_connection_set_require_close_notify().
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INAPPROPRIATE_FALLBACK

      static final int INAPPROPRIATE_FALLBACK
      The TLS handshake failed
      because the client sent the fallback SCSV, indicating a protocol
      downgrade attack. Since: 2.60
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      static final int BAD_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD
      The certificate failed
      to load because a password was incorrect. Since: 2.72
